definition: to volunteer for military service/to offer oneself for an assignment
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
tassel/sth shaped like a tassel (e.g. a leaf etc)/ribbon

sentences.english: As team captain, Darius volunteered to take the shots.
sentences.chinese: 作为队长，达利斯主动请缨去罚球。

sentences.english: Sandberg volunteered to oversee sales and operations for the project.
sentences.chinese: 桑德伯格主动请缨监督这一项目的销售和运营。

sentences.english: None of us had any idea what DB2 was, but I volunteered.
sentences.chinese: 没人了解DB2，但是我主动请缨。

definition: Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to ask sb to resign from a post
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to guard one's territory/to protect the country
to call for reinforcements/to bring in troops
to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
to join up/to enlist (e.g. in the military)
